result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Keith Skogquist #249421 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Amphetamine(<=3g) [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "F" Felony], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consecutive probation sentence to current prison sentence out of Washington County MN, Case #82-CR-15-1649.
Court notes 27 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Consecutive to: 82-CR-15-1649

miscConds.notes:
Apply bond on file.
Balance of $18.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF291.

-Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS Assessment and the Agent.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
-Maintain Absolute Sobriety.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Scott Keith Skogquist #249421 appeared from jail.  Case called at 10:13 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a plea and sentencing. ADA Minser recites agreement. State will orally amend Ct. 1 to a Class F Felony and remove the repeater enhancer. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to amended Ct 1 Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine as a Class F Felony w/o repeater enhancer  in 15CF291. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of amended Ct 1 Manufacture/Deliver Amphetamine as a Class F Felony w/o repeater enhancer in 15CF291.  Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement.  QUASH WARRANT. 20 days to file appeal. Court will mark Register of Actions as Exhibit #1. 

Crt orders:

-    S/W 3 years consecutive probation sentence to current prison sentence out of Washington Co, MN case # 82-CR-15-1649. 27 days jail credit to be applied if probation is revoked. 

-   Complete all other programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections

-   Court costs of $268.00 and DNA Surcharge $250.00. Bond to apply. Remainder to be refunded to payor. 

-    DNA Sample

-   Maintain absolute sobriety 

-    AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.

CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Joseph Robert Caton   DF:  Scott Keith Skogquist #249421 appeared from jail. Case called at 11:44 a.m. Court notes this is the date and time set for a pre trial conference. Atty Caton states there is a potential agreement. Set for plea and sentencing. ADA Minser will be checking into inner state retainer if DE will stay until next week. Atty Caton requesting DE be returned to Moose Lake. ADA Minser would like DE to stay. Court will reset plea to tomorrow a.m. ADA Minser states there was a request from Surety to return bond. Court will address bond issue tomorrow.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
